description.hltext_display: 三明市2010年旅游工作思路新鲜出炉
description.content:
字体显示：大 中 小
12月17日，三明市旅游局局长陈欣主持召开全市旅游局长工作会议，精心谋划2011年工作思路。
明年是实施“十二五”旅游规划的起步年，会议提出2011年全市旅游工作打算。围绕建设海峡西岸重要生态和文化旅游胜地的总体目标，强化宣传促销工作，重点实施“一二三四五”计划：一是启动“十万人游三明”计划，实施一批集团采购；二是联手武夷山主攻长三角和珠三角市场，举办两场促销；三是举办“千里客家采风活动”、“重走红军路、领略苏区情”等三场主题活动；四是参加国际旅交会、国内旅交会、海博会、林博会四大专业会场；五是开展“投央视、联网络、上高路、进动车、入社区”五种专业促销；狠抓产品开发，重点突破乡村旅游示范点、红色旅游、文化唱戏等产品；围绕行业争优创先，开展“创星、创A、选秀、提质、创先”活动；加快产业推动，树立发展理念，以产业发展壮大论地位，继续实施目标考核制度，积极构建两大运作平台。(三明市旅游局 林挺)

description.hltext_display: Il n'a pas fait de cadeau à sa présidente !
description.content:
Claude-Pierre Chauveau, élu de Tours, vice-président aux finances et chef du groupe de la majorité, a pris ses distances avec Claude Roiron.
Claude-Pierre Chauveau, élu du canton de Tours-Sud, a exprimé son irritation en public, lundi, au conseil général. Il est en froid avec sa présidente. Un de plus. - (dr)
Voilà un vice-président plutôt désorienté par les orientations budgétaires de sa présidente. Et il l'a fait savoir lundi en session du conseil général, ce qui a jeté un froid au sein de la majorité socialiste une nouvelle fois en difficulté.
Claude-Pierre Chauveau, élu du canton de Tours-Sud, est candidat à sa succession en mars. Il est vice-président aux finances, à l'économie, à la vie associative et à la démocratie départementale. Tout de même. Et il est le président du groupe de la majorité PS-PC. Eh bien c'est lui qui, aujourd'hui, prend ses distances avec Claude Roiron. Un de plus, après l'acte de dissidence collective mené par les maires de Joué et La Riche.
Avant-hier, Claude-Pierre Chauveau a commencé par citer Jean Germain, avec qui il a fait son droit à la fac. Malin, quand on sait que le maire de Tours et la présidente du conseil général ne sont pas toujours sur la même longueur d'ondes. Puis, il a dit son trouble sur la gouvernance de Claude Roiron et sur plusieurs dossiers qui « l'inquiètent » et qu'il assimile à de « l'affichage » : les collèges, l'investissement, l'endettement. « Moi, j'aligne les chiffres. J'ai un problème avec l'emprunt. » Et d'insister : « Je crains que cette volonté d'affichage aggrave les difficultés financières du conseil général. » On croyait entendre Philippe Le Breton, l'ex-chargé des finances, quand il a basculé dans la dissidence en 2008. A la présidente, Claude-Pierre Chauveau disait « comprendre sa fougue » mais doutait de sa « rigueur », histoire d'enfoncer le clou.
Celle-ci encaissait mais après la réunion, devant la presse, elle commentait : « Être vice-président, c'est un gros travail. Il faut être disponible et présent ! » Claude-Pierre Chauveau appréciera.
repères
Claude-Pierre Chauveau n'a pas apprécié d'avoir été écarté de la préparation du budget 2011. En froid depuis des mois avec Claude Roiron, il ne fait plus mystère de sa volonté, maintenant, de se présenter à la présidence du conseil général en mars, s'il est réélu sur son canton. Autre candidat dont on parle, Alain Michel, ex-dissident, qui attend janvier pour s'exprimer. Cela commence à faire beaucoup. « Je suis sereine », conclut Claude Roiron qui aura donc des concurrents socialistes face à elle pour sa réélection à la présidence.
billet
Compliqué
C'est toujours compliqué au PS entre la fédération et la présidente du conseil général. Monique Chevet (proche de Claude Roiron) défie toujours Alain Dayan (soutenu par la fédé) sur son canton de Tours-Est : « Quand il y viendra, il comprendra qu'il n'a aucune chance de gagner. » Le canton de Luynes serait offert aux Verts mais le candidat PS Joël Ageorges se maintiendrait, ce qui ne vexerait pas Claude Roiron. Autre souci, Azay-le-Rideau où la présidente ne souhaiterait pas une candidature PS pour avantager le maire d'Azay dont elle est proche, Michel Verdier, candidat divers gauche.
le chiffre
50
C'est, en millions, ce que les droits de mutation (les ventes immobilières) vont rapporter au conseil général en 2011, selon les prévisions. Une somme qui doit permettre au département de baisser son emprunt et d'investir. Ces droits ont battu des records en 2007 (59 M€), 2008 (54 M€), avant de chuter en 2009 (40 M€) à cause de la crise et de remonter en 2010 (48,5 M€). Michel Kopfler (cabinet de consultant), invité au conseil général lundi pour parler finances locales, annonce « une situation financière équilibrée jusqu'en 2012, pas après ».
la phrase
Je n'aurai pas de manifestations sous mes fenêtres contre cette prime de 100 € »,
s'est défendue la présidente Claude Roiron en session de conseil général, lundi, alors que l'opposition s'étonnait « par ces temps de rigueur » (et à trois mois des cantonales) d'une telle prime offerte aux 2.800 fonctionnaires et contractuels du département pour cette fin d'année. Alors que l'opposant et ancien chef d'entreprise Jean Savoie souriait, Claude Roiron lui lançait : « Vous n'avez peut-être pas de difficultés pour finir vos fins de mois, M. Savoie ! » Ce dernier lui rétorquait, à propos d'argent : « Je n'en ai pas plus que vous, Madame ! »

description.hltext_display: Judge rejects Disney's bid for new trial in 'Millionaire' case worth $319M
description.content:
LOS ANGELES, Calif. - A federal judge refused Tuesday to order a new trial in a lawsuit that resulted in a $319 million judgment against Walt Disney Co. over profits from the TV show "Who Wants to Be a Millionaire."
U.S. District Judge Virginia Phillips wrote in a 54-page ruling that evidence supported the jury verdict in favour of London-based Celador International.
The company sued in 2004, accusing Disney of using creative accounting to hide profits.
Celador won a $269.2 million jury verdict in July, and the companies later agreed that a $50 million interest payment to the show's creators was warranted.
Disney attorneys have argued the judge improperly excluded certain evidence and testimony. Disney has called the verdict "fundamentally wrong" and is likely to appeal.
Lawyer Martin D. Katz, who represents the entertainment giant, did not immediately return a phone message seeking comment about the latest ruling.
"Who Wants to Be a Millionaire" first aired in the U.S. from August 1999 to May 2002. It was then hosted by Regis Philbin and was a smash hit for ABC.
The trial earlier this year included testimony by top brass at Disney, and evidence included an email from former chairman and CEO Michael Eisner that the show was worth "$1B, wild guess, maybe more."
Disney argued that the jury shouldn't have been shown that email, but Phillips' ruling states the jury had other evidence to support its verdict.

description.hltext_display: Мэрия дала согласие на митинг оппозиции на Триумфальной площади 31 декабря
description.content:
Московские власти дали согласие на проведение митинга оппозиции на Триумфальной площади 31 декабря. Заявителями мероприятия выступают председатель Московской Хельсинкской группы Людмила Алексеева, правозащитники Лев Пономарев и Олег Орлов, активисты Сергей Удальцов и Роман Доброхотов, а также лидер движения «В защиту Химкинского леса» Евгения Чирикова. Об этом в среду сообщает «Интерфакс».
По словам Алексеевой, акция в защиту 31-й статьи Конституции «согласована на 100%» и состоится на Триумфальной в канун Нового года в 18:00 мск. При этом глава МХГ подчеркнула, что организатора митинга согласились с требованием властей сократить численность участников мероприятия с 1 500 до 1 000 человек.
Сама 83-летняя правозащитника пообещала, как и в прошлом году, появиться на предновогоднем митинге в костюме Снегурочки. «Эта уже стало для меня традицией 31 декабря. Буду ее поддерживать», – пояснила Алексеева.
Руководитель управления координации деятельности по обеспечению безопасности Москвы Валерий Кадацкий уже заверил организаторов, что правоохранительные органы будут следить за тем, чтобы на акции не было провокаций со стороны радикальных националистов. В мэрии, однако, отказались идти навстречу пожеланиям оппозиции в вопросе освобождения площади от ограждений, по официальной версии, появившихся на Триумфальной в связи с предстоящей реконструкцией территории.
В городскую администрацию поступала и вторая заявка на проведение митинга 31 декабря. Ее подавали бывшие соратники Алексеевой – Эдуард Лимонов, Константин Косякин и Владимир Буковский, однако чиновники предложили им ряд дополнительных ограничений, и оппозиционеры отказались от поиска компромисса с властью и пообещали устроить несанкционированную акцию.
По словам главы МХГ, все они приглашены на разрешенный митинг. Однако сторонники Лимонова уже заявили, что, несмотря на запрет, соберутся 31 декабря на Триумфальной отдельно от «санкционированной» оппозиции.

description.hltext_display: Un economista en Quetzaltenango
description.content:
Con el doctor Joseph Keckeissen coincidí muchas veces de 2003 a 2008, cuando por un proyecto educativo universitario viajé a Quetzaltenango quincenalmente. Lo fui a visitar el fin de semana recién pasado.
Anterior Siguiente
Me encontré con que aparentemente no reconocía a las personas. Le tomé la mano, empecé a hablarle y le pedía que me apretara la mano para saber si me entendía. Varias veces recibí ese apretón, y cuando me despedí, me miraba con mucha fijeza, como diciéndome “no te vayas”.
Biografía
Joseph Edward Keckeissen, más conocido como don Joe por sus alumnos, nació en Brooklyn, New York (USA), el 14 de enero de 1925. Sus padres fueron George Wilfred Keckeissen y Rita Grace McNally. A los 12 años de edad, sus padres decidieron enviarlo a estudiar a la “Salesian School” de Goshen, un internado a 70 millas de New York. Allí conoció al primer salesiano coadjutor, señor Nicolás Pierro, con quien entabló una fuerte amistad y del que guardó gratos recuerdos. También conoció al P. Ambrosio Rossi, Provincial de los salesianos de Estados Unidos en esa época, quien años después lo traerá a Centroamérica.
Pasado un solo año en Goshen, optó por trasladarse al seminario salesiano “Don Bosco College” de Newton (New Jersey), en donde pasó lo que él llamaba “los siete años felices” (1938-1945). Allí, terminada la High School, entró en el Noviciado, emitió su Profesión religiosa como “salesiano de Don Bosco” y cursó los estudios de Filosofía (Baccalaureatus Artium). Fue enviado entonces a realizar su experiencia pedagógica a las Casas salesianas de Marrero (1946), Tampa (1947) y New Rochelle (1948-1949).
Al finalizar ese período decidió, por dificultades de salud y otros motivos, no seguir adelante y retirarse de la Congregación. Al poco tiempo le tocó entrar en el Ejército: cumplió su servicio militar de 1950 a 1953, participando en la guerra de Corea como soldado paracaidista con el grado de teniente coronel. Quedó en la reserva desde 1953 a 1985.
Doctor en Economía
Al regresar, quiso terminar su educación superior y frecuentó la Graduate School of Business, de la Columbia University, New York (1954-1955), en la que obtuvo el título de Master of Business Administration (Gerencia). Entonces trabajó un tiempo en la Humble Oil and Refinig Company (Pehima, Baltimore), como contador, auditor y programador de la nueva sección de informática (1955-1962). Entre tanto, seguía los cursos de doctorado en la Graduate School of Business Administration, New York University, en donde obtuvo el título de “Philosophiae Doctor” en Economía. Durante esa época tuvo la feliz idea de escribir al P. Ambrosio Rossi, que estaba trabajando en San Salvador (El Salvador), quien le hizo la propuesta de regresar con los salesianos. Diálogos, cartas, reflexiones; y el 27 de diciembre de 1962 llegó a San Salvador, a ponerse a las órdenes del P. Segundo De Bernardi, Provincial de los salesianos de Centroamérica.
Ingresó al año siguiente en el Noviciado (Ayagualo, El Salvador), que tuvo que suspender por motivos de salud y regresar a curarse a los Estados Unidos, oportunidad que le tomó para concluir su doctorado. En 1971, ya recuperado, lo invitaron a regresar a Centroamérica para colaborar con el Ecónomo Provincial, pero ya sin pensar ser salesiano.
Humanizar el mercado
Más tarde se le invitó a pasar a Guatemala, para dar clases de Economía en la naciente Universidad Francisco Marroquín, y lo hizo como director del Departamento de Economía desde 1973. Lo hizo con amor y dedicación hasta recientemente. Lo hizo como convencido maestro de la filosofía de la libertad. Había escuchado en New York las lecciones de Ludwig Von Mises; sin embargo siempre se esforzó, con sentido crítico, por humanizar el sistema de mercado y acercarlo a la Doctrina Social católica. Y en ese sentido ha escrito artículos y ha dictado conferencias.
Los alumnos lo apreciaron mucho. La Universidad Marroquín, en 1989 le otorgó el Doctorado “honoris causa” en Ciencias Sociales. Sin embargo, seguía latente en Don Joe su antiguo amor a Don Bosco. Confesó un día: “Siempre estuvo en mi interior el deseo de ser salesiano; trataba de vivir su espíritu y colaborar de mil maneras con la obra salesiana. Por eso, en 1986, después de un retiro, tuve la idea de pedir volver a la Congregación. Mi antiguo maestro de novicios me apoyaba; lo mismo, muchos otros salesianos. Y ahora, este 8 de septiembre de 1990, he tenido la dicha de poder emitir los votos religiosos, otra vez después de tantos años de destierro”.
Desde entonces ha vivido ejemplarmente en diversas obras salesianas de Guatemala —los últimos 15 años en Quetzaltenango— como salesiano laico, dedicado a sus tareas académicas. En octubre de 2010 ha sufrido un grave “accidente cerebrovascular”, que hizo temer por su vida. Está en lentísima recuperación.

description.hltext_display: Have a blast
description.content:
Like a lemon or good luck, New Year’s Eve is what you make of it.
The year’s celebratory final hours might just constitute the most open-ended holiday on the calendar. Other than the obligatory champagne toast at midnight, Dec. 31 can be anything — glamorous, informal, low key or jail-worthy.
My own Eves in metro Denver have run the gamut — from small-scale dinner parties and dive-bar karaoke to upscale soirees, all-night parties and pricey downtown hotel packages.
Niche New Year’s Eves have become easier in the Internet age. Such websites as Meetup and Facebook have helped everyone from single parents to vegans tailor-make their pre-midnight get-togethers.
Geographical preferences are also easy to accommodate. South-suburbanites will find opportunities — from concerts in low-frills bars to large events in upscale hotels — around Arapahoe County and elsewhere in the south metro suburbs.
The Marriott Denver Tech Center, 4900 S. Syracuse St., will host its second annual [and aptly named] Champaign Hotel. For $100, you’ll enjoy the event’s title beverage, three stage of music [live and DJs], a laser light show and a $2,000 cash balloon drop at midnight.
Similarly, the Hyatt Regency DTC, 7800 E. Tufts Ave., will present it ninth White Rose Gala. Tickets range from $59 to $250 at this Egyptian-themed “living theater.” Ten-foot characters will reportedly greet guests as the sun god Ra flies about. Another $2,000 cash drop will top off the evening. Egyptian-theme attire is encouraged. No problem, right?
Littleton’s Town Hall Arts Center, 2450 W. Main St., will offer a far lower-key alternative when the 17th Avenue Allstars sing an evening of diverse a cappella music. Tickets are $25 for the 6:30 p.m. and 9:30 p.m. shows. The latter includes a champagne toast.
Far less pristine is the nearby Toad Tavern, 5302 S. Federal Court, which will host a New Year’s Eve concert with local favorites Nina Storey and Matthew Moon. The $25 ticket price includes a champagne toast.
Local offerings notwithstanding, some south-suburban revelers may find the prospect of free light rail enough to help them take the plunge into downtown Denver. As has become a tradition in recent years, all RTD services will be free from 7 p.m. New Year's Eve until 6 a.m. New Year's Day.
For those mulling the upscale end of the downtown spectrum, the Grand Hyatt, 1750 Welton St., is billing its goings-on as “Denver’s Grandest New Year’s Eve Party.” While the boast may ring of auld lang hyperbole, the event does promise to be anything understated.
For $109 per person, you get four rooms of entertainment, a buffet dinner, an open bar, a champagne toast at midnight and balloon drops galore, among other amenities too numerous to list. Hotel packages are also available. Did I mention the open bar?
If the price range doesn’t bother you, but you prefer a smaller crowd, consider Lannie’s Clocktower Cabaret, 1601 Arapahoe St. on the 16th Street Mall. The club’s namesake, Lannie Garrett, and her 10-piece Swingin’ Big Band will perform “AnySwing Goes!” The $125 ticket price equals a dessert bar, champagne, party hats and ... yes, noisemakers.
Single, but looking for someone to kiss at midnight? You’re on your own here. But I will mention that Jazz at Jack’s, 500 16th St., up the mall at the Denver Pavilions, is hosting a Singles New Years Eve Party. Bring your own breath mints.
If LoDo is your style, the 3-in-1 All Access New Years party might be the ticket. For $29.50, you’ll visit three of the neighborhood’s newest hotspots — The Drink, Mix Music Lounge and the Rack & Rye GastroPub. Ticket price includes appetizers, a champagne toast and a crash course in dance music — plus attractive staff, if you believe the website.
A more pricey club package is Passport New Year’s Eve. Suite 200 and other Larimer Square-area night spots will host five dance floors with custom lighting, “sexy go-go dancers,” and “celebrity appearances.” Every table gets gift bags valued at $200. Ticket prices weren’t available at press time.
Among downtown’s concert highlights will be Big Head Todd and the Monsters at the Paramount Theater and Widespread Panic at the Pepsi Center. No party favors at either venue, so slide into an area bar after the show.
Still not sold? Here are a few other random footnotes from across the New Years Eve spectrum:
The Mercury Café, 2199 California St., will host its 16th annual Erotic Poetry Festival followed by Boulder’s post-punk tango band Gora Gora Orkester. This will not be your mother’s New Year’s Eve.
For the glamorous set, the party’s at the Jet Hotel, 1612 Wazee St. This Hollywood Paparazzi Ball encourages patrons to dress up as their favorite celebrity.
Masked ball anyone? Tango du Masque, 1555 Grant Ave., offers a self-described “creative black-tie event” and tango show. “Quality Venetian masks” are welcome ... of course.
Rockers may have to opt for Captain Quirk and Friends, who will perform the Who’s rock opera “Tommy” in its entirety at Miner’s Alley Playhouse, 1224 Washington St. in Golden.
Of course, virtually any New Year’s Eve in the downtown area can be topped off at the 16th Street Mall’s midnight fireworks display. A similar show will take place at 9 p.m. for families and others less inclined toward midnight revelry.
Happy New Year. We’ll see you in 2011 ... with any luck.

description.hltext_display: 我国3D电视节目产业运行首次通过验证
description.content:
【慧聪广电网】昨天，笔者从工信部网站了解到，我国基于AVS标准的3D电视技术试验系统取得了重大进展，首次实现3D电视节目制作和播出系统的集成。据了解，这是我国3D节目从拍摄到视频输出的第一次验证。
消息称，该系统采用我国自主知识产权的AVS音视频编解码标准，涵盖了包括3D采编播设备、内容制作、终端显示设备等在内的关键技术，首次集成了AVS3D电视节目制作系统和AVS3D电视播出系统，对完善我国3D电视技术及产业链、推动自主音视频标准的应用具有积极作用。

description.hltext_display: Un budget '' robuste '' pour une année encore difficile
description.content:
Le budget 2011 a été adopté, hier, par le conseil municipal de Tours. L'opposition, divisée dans le discours mais solidaire dans les actes, a voté contre.
suivante précédente
Les répliques de la crise n'en finissent pas de se faire sentir et la « période est encore particulière », lâche le maire de Tours, Jean Germain, en présentant son budget 2011, qui s'élève à 300,90 millions d'euros (M€), hier matin, en ouverture du conseil municipal. « La préoccupation principale, c'est l'emploi, poursuit le maire. Avant tout, ce budget est un budget de soutien à l'activité. » Et de confirmer ce qui avait déjà été dit fin novembre, lors du débat d'orientations budgétaires : les impôts n'augmenteront pas. Ni la taxe des ordures ménagères, annonce le maire (*).
Pour autant, élaborer ce budget a été « un exercice très difficile », souligne l'adjoint chargé des Finances, Frédéric Thomas. « Outre le désengagement de l'État - moins 2,78 % pour la dotation globale de fonctionnement, 5 e année consécutive de baisse -, il faut désormais faire face à la réforme des collectivités territoriales. Ce contexte nous prive de 1,20 M€ de recettes. Voilà pourquoi nous souhaitons un budget robuste et volontaire, qui conciliera des exigences de solidarité. » Les subventions aux associations (21,40 M€) ne diminuent pas.
La dette reste élevée
Jean Germain a rappelé que l'encours de la dette par habitant (1.750 €), même s'il reste supérieur à la moyenne nationale, est revenu à « un niveau plus acceptable qu'en 1995 ».
Pour l'opposition, Bruno Lavillatte (UMP) approuve la décision de ne pas augmenter la pression fiscale, « signe de direction vertueuse ». Il ne critique pas franchement, nuance seulement mais affirme qu'il aurait aimé que l'investissement soit davantage privilégié, notamment en matière de tourisme. Par solidarité avec son groupe d'opposition, Bruno Lavillatte annonce son attention de voter contre le budget, mais il précise qu'ils sont plusieurs à avoir eu envie de seulement s'abstenir. Pas Françoise Amiot, ni Pascal Ménage (UMP), qui s'affichent alors comme des « contre-contre » : « Nous ne partageons pas votre vision », dit Pascal Ménage. « Ce n'est pas le seul tram qui va faire entrer la ville dans le XXI e siècle », annonce Françoise Amiot.
« En attendant, rétorque Josette Blanchet (PCF), les travaux préparatoires à l'arrivée du tram, c'est 1.000 personnes qui ne pointent pas au Pôle emploi et des bureaux d'études qui ne mettent pas la clé sous la porte. »
(*) La question sera examinée lors du conseil communautaire de Tour(s)plus, ce soir.
le chiffre
300,90
C'est, en millions d'euros (M€), le budget total de la Ville de Tours en 2011, en hausse de 4 M€ environ par rapport à 2010. Le budget de fonctionnement s'élèvera à 193,75 M€ et celui de fonctionnement à 74,50 M€. Les quatre budgets annexes cumulés se hissent, quant à eux, à 32,61 M€ : 26,15 M€ pour l'eau, 5,90 M€ pour les activités lyriques et symphoniques, 241.800 € pour le crématorium et 307.000 € pour les cimetières.
en bref
> LA DETTE, '' AH, GNA, GNA ''. Pascal Ménage a rappelé que le dernier classement PES des villes les mieux gérées (réalisé par l'agence Public evaluation system et publié dans le magazine Challenge) a attribué une très mauvaise note à la Ville de Tours (avant-dernière !). « Cette dette, nous l'avons héritée en 1995, elle a été faite par la précédente majorité municipale car il y a eu des erreurs, notamment la construction du centre de congrès Vinci sans l'aide d'aucune subvention », a répondu Jean Germain, qui a précisé que ce classement PES, établi depuis 2006, était rejeté par les maires des grandes villes de France, car ses calculs ne tiennent pas compte des financements intercommunaux. « Alors certains peuvent toujours râler et dire la dette ah, gna, gna... Ceux-là n'ont jamais rien géré. »
> ÉCONOMIES D'ÉNERGIE : ET L'AMBITION ? Les élus Verts ont voté le budget car ils partagent « les convictions » du maire, mais David Chollet a fait quelques remarques sur les choix d'investissement. « Il faudrait être plus ambitieux en matière d'économies d'énergie. »
> A PROPOS DE LA SUBVENTION DU BATEAU IVRE. « Le Bateau Ivre accueille sa dernière représentation. C'est toujours l'incertitude concernant la suite... Quid de la subvention jusqu'à présent versée par la Ville de Tours ? », a demandé Françoise Amiot. « Rien de nouveau depuis le débat d'orientations budgétaires, a répondu Colette Girard, adjointe au maire chargée des Affaires culturelles. La subvention de 45.000 € sera reconduite et sanctuarisée, en attendant un éventuel projet de reprise. »
Nous reviendrons sur les autres dossiers du conseil dans notre prochaine édition.

description.hltext_display: Recomienda investigador universitario que migrantes viajen en caravanas
description.content:
Destacó Moctezuma Longoria que a través del Programa Paisano, se establece que tendrán que venir en caravana. Foto: El Heraldo de Chihuahua
El Sol de Zacatecas
Rubén Valdez
Zacatecas, Zacatecas.- Los zacatecanos que están en Estados Unidos y los que están en otras partes como en el Distrito Federal, tendrán que venir en caravana y con vigilancia de la Policía Federal Preventiva y del Ejército porque se ha terminado la paz social que vivíamos, sostuvo Miguel Moctezuma Longoria, investigador universitario en entrevista.
Destacó Moctezuma Longoria que a través del Programa Paisano, se establece que tendrán que venir en caravana, que se dan en las publicaciones que se entregan precisamente a los paisanos que cruzan el territorio nacional desde el norte y hacia el estado zacatecano o desde el sur, desde el Distrito Federal y hacia el norte, a Zacatecas.
Entrevistado señaló el investigador universitario que si se deja de vigilar a los paisanos para cuidarlos, si no traen arriba de sus vehículos alguna pancarta que señale que son precisamente migrantes, estas caravanas se convierten en un asunto peligroso porque se les puede confundir con otras cuestiones.
En el país, el grado de inseguridad ha crecido como nunca y también es posible que se tenga una presencia muy reducida de migrantes lo que a su vez repercute en la economía de los migrantes tanto de los que vienen como los familiares que están aquí.
Pero también sucede con las personas que viven en México, ya resulta una preocupación salir de vacaciones y no lejos sino a los vecinos estados porque si se sale en vuelo aéreo se puede convertir en un dolor de cabeza, no solamente en el traslado en vehículos.
El mantener esta guerra resulta irracional, "pienso que esta situación le va a costar la presidencia al PAN, e incluso si llegara a ser un presidente panista, tiene que romper con esta política de confrontación, es una guerra que ha perdido el gobierno y que se ha llevado entre las patas a muchos ciudadanos comunes y dentro del aparato de estado parece que hay gente que está metida".
"Para combatir la inseguridad primero tendrían que revisarse ellos mismos y cuando hagan eso, la gente puede confiar en ellos, pero como no lo hacen, son peligrosos para cualquier persona de la sociedad civil y eso todo mundo lo sabe", señaló.
Recordó el caso de Marisela Escobedo a quien le asesinaron a su hija y luego protestó porque el responsable confesó su crimen y a pesar de eso, quedó absuelto por tres jueces. Protestó en Chihuahua frente al palacio gubernamental y desafortunadamente fue muerta de un balazo en la cabeza.
Los jueces no pueden ser solamente separados de sus cargos, deben ir a parar a la cárcel pero además porque se trata de actos de corrupción y si no hay algo que invite a la sociedad en general a que crea en las instituciones, éstas se van a derrumbar.
El gran problema es que la sociedad civil no tiene voz, pero además para decirle al gobierno que está mal, cuando se está en contra de estas iniciativas equivocadas contra la guerra, pareciera que es un traidor cuando en el fondo que se les puede exigir que limpien primero la casa por dentro y entonces va a funcionar el 066, pero mientras no suceda esto, es un peligro para la misma sociedad.

description.hltext_display: 'Country Strong'
description.author: BETSY SHARKEY - Los Angeles Times
description.content:
LOS ANGELES -- There is a down-home comfort saturating "Country Strong," in that "somebody done somebody wrong song" way, that almost carries you through when its music-drenched melodrama gets predictable. Which is pretty much as soon as the fragile, still-in-rehab country superstar played by Gwyneth Paltrow starts talking about the baby bird she's found and is trying to save. So like, Scene 2.
Paltrow's Kelly Canter is trying to mend her own broken wing, her drinking and on-stage meltdowns having put her career in need of rehab and recovery too. The actress brings her own surprisingly sweet voice to the foot-stomping, two-stepping proceedings with such surety that if you didn't catch her coming-out party on the Country Music Association Awards last month (or on "Glee," or missed "Duets" in 2000 with Paltrow singing and her late dad, Bruce, directing), you'll probably find yourself saying, "Wow, that girl can sing." Which, as it happens, is not necessarily the take-away you want from a movie, even one about the roughhouse country music industry, though it always becomes a topic when actors take on these roles.
It's a very tough arena that writer/director Shana Feste has chosen to play in, given such classic movies and classic performances as Sissy Spacek in "Coal Miner's Daughter," Robert Duvall in "Tender Mercies," Jessica Lange in "Sweet Dreams," Reese Witherspoon in "Walk the Line" and Jeff Bridges in last year's "Crazy Heart." The roles won Oscars for all but Lange, who did get a nomination. When the starting point is a world in which even the toughest guys wear their hearts on their sleeves, the trick for filmmakers is how to walk the line without getting stuck in the muck, and that is a problem the filmmaker hasn't yet figured out. "Country Strong" is Feste's second film and she infuses it with an earnestness that swings between too too much and appealing, the same earnestness that swamped her filmmaker debut last year with "The Greatest." But this time, in the more nuanced moments (and there are some of those), she has a way with dialogue that could turn her into a force if she can ever get the balance right and send the obvious packing.
The story is an all-too-familiar one, that deadly cocktail of too much fame and too much drink for someone who's lost touch with who they really are anymore. The film opens with Kelly about to trade rehab for the road again. Her husband-manager James, played by real life country music superstar Tim McGraw and about the only one in the movie who doesn't sing, is sure she's ready. Besides, James has a double shot in mind - jump-starting Kelly's stalled career while launching another, a sassy bit of hot sauce just off the beauty pageant circuit named Chiles Stanton ("Gossip Girl's" Leighton Meester).
Meanwhile, Kelly's sober buddy at the facility, an attentive singer-songwriting hunk named Beau (Garrett Hedlund) with bedroom eyes and talent - a lethal cocktail in its own right - is not so sure. With that, the filmmaker has stacked the deck with four combustible egos primed to be manipulated by ambition, need, love, betrayal and backsliding - so you know going in there's no way anyone is going to walk away unscathed from the emotional wreckage that is sure to come.
Director of photography John Bailey opens things up, pouring a lot of light into all the dark places Feste has created. Although the film unfolds in and around Dallas, shooting it on location in Nashville has served to give the look a rock-solid foundation that Bailey takes full advantage of. The music (in the hands of Michael Brook and music supervisor Randall Poster) that runs through the production is a blend of old standards from the Merle Haggard and Hank Williams set, and the new country of Hayes Carll (check out his "Bad Liver and a Broken Heart" sometime). Whether in dive bars with bare stages or big-hair blow-outs, staging the performances is where the filmmaker finds her comfort zone.
What helps elevate "Country Strong" when the music stops is the strength of the performances. Paltrow is an actress who slips into roles as if they were old sweats, creating a kind of organic fit whether it's the light loveliness of her theater romantic in "Shakespeare in Love" or her darkly used down-market girl in "Two Lovers." As Kelly, she brings a rural authenticity and human touch that are never better than when she plays to a Make-a-Wish kid named Travis.
It's not easy to play opposite that, but McGraw does a credible job. He is such an appealing guy on screen, working an easy charm in a way that seems so effortless, it's turning him into Hollywood's good old boy of choice (see "The Blind Side"). But the scene stealer is the Minnesota farm boy, Hedlund, who took up the guitar for the film and despite an acting hot streak that includes "Tron: Legacy," actually could quit his day job. His scruffy Hank Williams-style baritone and kickback charisma on stage makes Beau irresistible to more than just Kelly. For the most part, Hedlund comes off as a natural, never in a hurry, relying on instinct to know when and how to play the hand he's been dealt.
Feste has the right instincts too, she just doesn't have the ease yet. The voice in "Country Strong," though unsteady still, is distinctive enough, especially on the emotional notes, that you hope she figures out how to get it right.
COUNTRY STRONG
MPAA rating: PG-13 for thematic elements involving alcohol abuse and some sexual content
Running time: 1 hour, 52 minutes
Playing: Limited release

description.hltext_display: Sydney's best beer gardens
description.content:
Sink some beers at Sydney's best open-air watering holes
If you're visiting Sydney for the first time, no doubt you'll be heading straight to somewhere like the Opera Bar for a drink and an astonishing view. Sydney Opera House, Lower Concourse, Bennelong Point, Sydney 2000. (02 9247 1666).
The newly refurbed Beresford is a must if you like an outdoor drink. The massive beer garden is festooned with Chinese lanterns and foliage as far as the eye can see. 354 Bourke St, Darlinghurst 2010. (02 9357 1111).
Every summer, Bondi comes to life with Cream Tangerine - an outdoor bar atop the Swiss Grand Hotel slingin' tiki drinks with water views. Swiss Grand, Campbell Pde (Cnr Curlewis St), Bondi 2026. (02 9300 8471).
If you're keen on getting your dance on, head to the Slip Inn - not only do they have a massive leafy courtyard, but they also host outdoor summer club nights. 111 Sussex St, Sydney 2000. (02 8297 7000).
Chilled/jungle/break/tubthumpin' beatz aren't everyone's cuppa, though, so if it's a quiet schooey you're after, head to the likes of the Courthouse Hotel 202 Australia St, Newtown 2042. (02 9519 8273).
The Golden Barley has real grass, big umbrellas and lots of large tables for chatty groups. 165 Edgeware Rd, Enmore 2042. (02 9565 1166).
Sprawling, megalithic pubs are another Sydney specialty. The Newport Arms, jewel of the north, overlooks the broad blue expanse of Pittwater. Cnr Beaconsfield & Kalinya St, Newport 2106. (02 9997 4900).
Or head to well heeled Double Bay to the Golden Sheaf where the back bar flows seamlessly to the massive outside area. 429 New South Head Rd, Double Bay 2023. (02 9327 5877).
Nothing, friends, beats a roof bar. And Sydney has ‘em in spades: head to the Glenmore for views of Sydney Harbour with your schooner. 96 Cumberland St, The Rocks 2000. (02 9247 4794).
If you want to fancy it right up (with the dollars to match) get your togs on and dive in at ivy Pool Club. You don't have to look like a million dollars in your swimwear, but it helps. 320 George St, Sydney 2000. (02 9240 3000). Myffy Rigby
More of Sydney's best bars?

description.content:
안硏, 2010년 보안위협 화두는 `스턱스넷·스마트폰`
안硏, 2010년 보안위협 화두는 `스턱스넷·스마트폰`
[아이뉴스24] 입력 2010.12.22 15:08
내블로그에 저장
올 한해 사회기반시설을 타깃으로 한 스턱스넷 공격, 사회공학적 기법 공격, 스마트폰 보안위협 등이 주요 보안 위협 트렌드에 선정됐다.
안철수연구소(대표 김홍선)는 `2010년 10대 보안 위협 트렌드`를 22일 발표했다.
올해 가장 주목 받은 보안 위협은 `스턱스넷(Stuxnet)`이었다. 교통·전기·수도·발전소와 같은 사회 기반 시설의 제어 시스템을 감염시켜 오작동을 유발시키는 공격의 등장으로 우려를 낳았다. 이런 스턱스넷 공격은 `사이버 전쟁의 서막`이라는 평가를 받았다.
스마트폰과 소셜네트워킹서비스(SNS)를 이용한 보안위협도 올해 급증했다. 악성코드를 포함한 어플리케이션이 생겨났고 금전적 피해를 주는 사건도 발생했다. `정보의 허브`역할을 한 트위터와 페이스북 등 SNS가 악성코드 유포경로로 악용되는 역기능도 발생했다.
한편 올해도 크고 작은 DDoS 공격이 계속됐다. 좀비PC를 만들어내는 대표적 악성코드인 `팔레보`는 올해 다양한 변종으로 크게 확산됐다.
또 사이버 공격의 수단으로 국제적 이슈를 악용하는 `사회공학적 기법`사례도 발견됐다. 특히 e메일, 파일 공유 사이트 등을 통해 피해가 확산됐다. 올해 동계올림픽, 월드컵 등 국제 스포츠 행사가 많았다는 점에서 사용자들을 현혹시키는 사례가 종종 목격되기도 했다.
이 밖에 악성코드 배포 방식의 지능화, 제로데이 취약점 발견, 피싱의 다양화, 금전을 노린 국산 악성코드의 확산, 온라인게임 해킹 툴 급증 등이 올 한해 국내 보안이슈로 떠올랐다.
안철수연구소 전성학 실장은 "스마트폰, SNS 등 사용자의 관심이 쏠리는 곳에 악성코드도 도사리고 있다"고 말했다.
이어 "교묘해지는 공격 기법과 유포 방식에 대응하기 위해 전문적이고 체계적인 보안 관리와 서비스가 중요하다"고 조언했다.
/김병주기자 kbj0215@inews24.com
IT는 아이뉴스24 연예ㆍ스포츠는 조이뉴스24

description.hltext_display: 56网新版首页上线：突出娱乐和原创栏目
description.content:
【慧聪广电网】今天上午，视频网站56网（我乐网）创始人周娟在腾讯微博中透露，56网新首页正式上线。改版后，更加突出娱乐和原创两个部分，并打造品牌栏目――56创造。
腾讯科技注意到，改版后的56网首页中，娱乐版块以明星新闻、综艺节目、电视剧、电影、音乐为主。据透露，围绕此内容，56网将与各家演艺机构、版权发行机构和电视台加大合作力度。
原创版块以个人导演作品展示、火星搞笑视频、网络红人表演、美女主播以及全国各地拍客作品内容为主，主打草根娱乐。其中，56网推出“56创造”品牌栏目。
整体而言，56网此次改版，页面设计更加简洁，更体现互动元素，同时新建动态的站外转帖榜，更加凸显微博、论坛引用的热门视频。
目前，56网社区产品中有“我贴、空间、美女主播”三大板块，服务类产品有视频、专辑、直播、相册视频等。

description.hltext_display: US poised to approve nuclear arms pact with Russia
description.content:
By Desmond Butler
The Senate is poised to approve a nuclear arms pact with Russia, handing President Barack Obama a huge victory on his top foreign policy priority.
Passage of the New START treaty appeared assured after 11 Republicans joined Democrats in a vote Tuesday to end debate on the pact. That signaled that Obama should have the two-thirds majority he needs when the Senate votes on final approval Wednesday.
The approval would mark a big comeback for Obama's arm controls efforts after the treaty appeared all but dead just weeks ago. It also would allow Obama to continue efforts to improve relations with Russia.
Ratification would mark a third recent major political victory for Obama, even though his Democratic party was trounced in last month's congressional elections. In recent days he won passage of a bipartisan tax deal and a vote ending the ban on gays openly serving in the military.
"We are on the brink of writing the next chapter in the 40-year history of wrestling with the threat of nuclear weapons," Foreign Relations Committee Chairman John Kerry, a Democrat, said after the vote.
The treaty would limit each country's strategic nuclear warheads to 1,550, down from the current ceiling of 2,200. It also would establish a system for monitoring and verification. US weapons inspections ended last year with the expiration of a 1991 treaty.
The administration was adamant that it be ratified this year because the Democrats' majority in the Senate is set to shrink by five in January and waiting could have meant months of delay or defeat.
Republicans accused Democrats of rushing approval of the treaty for political reasons. They have asserted it would limit US missile defense options and argued it has insufficient procedures to verify Russia's adherence.
When Jon Kyl, the leading Republican on negotiations over the treaty, suggested a delay last month, Obama appeared unlikely to find the nine Republican votes needed for passage.
But he and top members of his administration lobbied intensely, with Obama postponing his Christmas vacation in Hawaii. They enlisted support from top military officials and big-name Republicans from past administrations who argued the treaty was essential for US national security.
In the end, they persuaded enough Republicans to defy the party's top two leaders in the Senate and support the pact.
"We know when we've been beaten," Republican Sen. Orrin Hatch told reporters hours before Tuesday's vote.
Even the Senate's No. 3 Republican, Lamar Alexander, endorsed the accord, saying he was assured US defenses would not be weakened.
The treaty will leave the United States "with enough nuclear warheads to blow any attacker to kingdom come," Alexander said on the Senate floor.
Republicans had tried to kill the treaty by forcing changes in its language that would have sent it back for negotiations with Moscow. Democrats were working to appease some Republican senators by letting them raise these issues in legislation accompanying the treaty that would not directly affect the treaty.
Most Republicans remained opposed.
"The administration did not negotiate a good treaty," Kyl said. "They went into the negotiations it seems to me with the attitude with the Russians just like the guy who goes into the car dealership and says, `I'm not leaving here until I buy a car.'"
Though Kyl looks likely to vote on the losing side of the debate over the treaty, in his negotiations with the administration he did win Obama's commitment to modernize the remaining nuclear arsenal with projected spending of $85 billion over 10 years.
Some of that money is now in the pipeline, contained in a stopgap government funding bill that cleared Congress on Tuesday. The measure would finance the government, mostly at current levels, through March 4.
It makes an exception for nuclear security programs, allowing the government to spend money to modernize the United States' nuclear arsenal at a rate equal to Obama's $624 million request.
AP

description.hltext_display: Oil and natural gas daily review (December 22, 2010)
description.content:
Crude oil prices climbed back above $90 for only the second time in two years on Tuesday, led by unseasonal gains in gasoline as New York supplies tighten and on chilly weather that has helped stimulate demand. - U.S. crude oil inventories dropped sharply last week, the American Petroleum Institute (API) said on Tuesday, propelling prices to $90 a barrel for only the second time since 2008.
- South Korea wants companies to supply 30 percent of the country's combined oil and gas imports from projects almost all abroad by 2019, up from 9 percent in 2009, as it looks to increase self-sufficiency.
- Japan's commercial crude inventories rose 891,000 kilolitres from the week before to 15.9 million kilolitres (100 million barrels) in the week to Dec. 18, the Petroleum Association of Japan (PAJ) said.
- Italy's imports of crude oil from Iran rose by 90.8 percent year-on-year to 8.29 million tonnes in the first nine months of 2010, Italy's industry group Unione Petrolifera (UP) said on Tuesday.
- Oil refinery output in 16 European countries rose by 10.7 percent in November on the back of a sharp increase in refinery runs; data from industry oil monitor Euroilstock showed on Tuesday. Crude oil prices are trading higher on NYMEX today. In the evening session we have the crude oil inventory report to be released by the EIA. An expectation of a drawdown in stocks is further likely to support the prices of crude oil. Buying at dips is the recommendation for the day.

description.hltext_display: Calera, Zacatecas no tiene alto índice de emigración, asegura alcalde
description.content:
Se tienen una serie de planes encaminados a trabajar bajo el esquema del programa 3x1, sostuvo Rodrigo Saucedo Ramírez, alcalde de Calera. Foto: El Sol de Zacatecas
El Sol de Zacatecas
Redacción
Calera, Zacatecas.- En comparación con municipios como; Valparaíso, Jerez, Villanueva y Tlaltenango entre otros donde el índice de emigración es sumamente alto y existen comunidades que poco a poco se quedan solas, Calera se encuentra entre las municipalidades que menos mano de obra exporta, ello debido a que existen las condiciones necesarias para arraigar a sus habitantes y a que se queden, así lo informó el Presidente Municipal Rodrigo Saucedo Ramírez quien aun así aseguro que se tienen varios proyectos para trabajar con el programa 3x1 y exhortar a los connacionales a que trabajen por sus comunidades.
Detalló que en su reciente visita por la unión americana especialmente en el estado de Illinois sostuvo importantes mesas de trabajo con inversionistas originarios de éste municipio con muy buenos resultados porque éstos calerenses tienen intenciones de invertir en su municipio en la creación de fuentes de empleo, pero no sabían cual mecanismo seguir, mostrando una excelente disposición para trabajar en bien de las personas que se quedaron en su lugar de origen.
Aseguró que aun así, se tienen una serie de planes encaminados a trabajar bajo el esquema del programa 3x1, mecanismo que por no haber sido efectuado de manera correcta dejó algunas obras inconclusas como lo es la construcción material de la iglesia de la comunidad de Ramón López Velarde por mencionar algunas, mismas que encontraran continuidad en la presente administración "pues no podemos dejar abandonadas e inconclusas obras que por sí mismas representan una gran importancia para la sociedad por lo tanto, la administración que encabezo será muy respetuosa de éste tipo de problemas y sin criticar ni buscar las razones por las cuales las obras no se terminaron, se hará todo lo posible para su culminación en el menor tiempo", sostuvo.
Al destacar que el programa 3x1 es un potencial económico considerable como para hacerlo a un lado, repuso que dentro del plan municipal de desarrollo en ésta localidad se tienen algunas propuestas para trabajar dentro del mismo, teniendo planeado visitar algunas ciudades de la unión americana donde se tiene un mayor núcleo de calerenses para exhortarlos para que se unan mediante la integración de clubes y así sea posible efectuar las obras que se tienen ya debidamente identificadas con sus respectivos proyectos, por lo tanto insistió que, aunque éste municipio no sea un exportador de mano de obra considerable, se aprovechará al máximo el programa 3x1.

description.hltext_display: Journalist: Gov. 'dragging feet' on pardon record-request
description.content:
isement
Gov. Bill Richardson has said that he is reviewing a petition to pardon the outlaw Billy the Kid, but he hasn't revealed who else he might forgive before leaving office, despite requests dating back to last month.
Unearthing that information in response to reporters' requests will take some time, but his office said Tuesday it is working on it, an official said.
In November, both The New Mexican and freelance journalist Peter St. Cyr starting seeking information on the people who have applied for a pardon, or to have their sentence commuted, ahead of Richardson's departure as governor Dec. 31.
So far, no names have been released and both reporters have been told their requests are too broad or burdensome.
The New Mexican in November requested any documents related to people seeking pardons or commutations, including information submitted with each request.
The Governor's Office did not say why the request was burdensome and/or broad. In general, the state's Inspection of Public Records Act gives a public agency 15 days to respond with information, unless records are already in archives, for example, and it will take longer to retrieve them.
The New Mexican revised its request to include "copies of the request letters or forms submitted by those making requests for clemency in the calendar year of 2010."
In response, the Governor's Office on Dec. 14 said it believed the request was still too "burdensome and/or broad due to the fact that many of our records have been archived and retrieving those documents will take time." The office said it needed additional "reasonable" time to respond, but did not give a date. Gov.-elect Susana Martinez takes office Jan. 1.
St. Cyr on Nov. 11 first requested information about who had applications pending. He asked for "all applications for executive clemency received in the past six months, including applications for full pardons, commutation of sentences, conditional releases, reprieves, pardons to restore civil rights and summary reports received from the Probation and Parole Board," as well as "any and all letters attached to the applications and letters of recommendation." He asked to inspect applications approved within the last 50 months.
The state now considers that query a new request, thus resetting the clock on the legal timeline by which the state is obligated to respond. It considers his first request closed.
In a letter to St. Cyr's attorney, Paul Livingston, Richardson's deputy counsel, Stephanie Kiger, said the state has until Dec. 29 to respond to his revised request and has complied with the state's Inspection of Public Records Act.
Livingston accuses the office of violating the state's records act in part by not being more timely with the information.
"The law requires they produce the documents immediately or as soon as is practicable," he said. "This isn't immediate since we asked for it in November."
St. Cyr said Richardson is dragging his feet on what should be a simple request.
"Frankly, their claim the records are in boxes for archiving is not a reasonable excuse to deem the request burdensome, especially since they announced they had received a request to pardon Billy the Kid just last week," he said.
The state in the past has released information about people who were pardoned or had their sentences commuted. The Albuquerque Tribune in 2006 reported that Richardson pardoned 28 people in 2005. In 2004, he pardoned 11 people and commuted one sentence.
By comparison, Richardson's predecessor, Gary Johnson, gave clemency to an average of 13.5 people annually during his first four-year term, the newspaper reported. In his second term, Johnson averaged 18 people a year, although he didn't give anyone clemency in 2001.
Contact Kate Nash at 986-3036 or knash@sfnewmexican.com. Read her blog at www.greenchilechatter.com.

description.hltext_display: Fight looms after Texas gets 4 new US House seats
description.author: JAY ROOT
description.content:
AUSTIN, Texas A surge of Hispanic residents and other population gains have Texas poised to add more congressional clout than any other state, but a partisan fight now looms over exactly where the new seats should go.
Texas is gaining four seats in the U.S. House, twice as many as Florida, the only other state to pick up multiple ones, according to new population figures announced Tuesday by the U.S. Census Bureau. All told, Republican-leaning states will pick up at least a half dozen House seats thanks to the 2010 census, which found the nation's population growing more slowly than in past decades but still shifting to the South and West.
With Texas Republicans using recent elections to fortify their already solid control of the state Legislature, the political process of redrawing the state's congressional map would seem to benefit the GOP, too.
But Democrats say not so fast.
Boyd Richie, chairman of the Texas Democratic Party, said Hispanic and black population growth account for the additional seats, and he vowed to fight for a redistricting plan that takes their numbers into account.
"A legal and fair redistricting process must produce new congressional districts that reflect the Hispanic and African American population growth," Richie said. "Our Democratic numbers may be down, but we are not out. Democrats cannot and will not allow our voices to be silenced in this critical process."
The Census Bureau said the nation's population on April 1 was 308,745,538, up from 281.4 million a decade ago. The growth rate for the past decade was 9.7 percent, the lowest since the Great Depression. The U.S. population grew by 13.2 percent from 1990 to 2000. Michigan was the only state to lose population during the past decade. Nevada, with a 35 percent increase, was the fastest-growing state.
The new numbers are a boon for Republicans, with Texas leading the way among GOP-leaning states that will gain House seats, mostly at the Rust Belt's expense. Following each once-a-decade census, the nation must reapportion the House's 435 districts to make them roughly equal in population, with each state getting at least one seat.
In all, the census figures show a shift affecting 18 states taking effect when the 113th Congress takes office in 2013. The political power follows the high population growth, shifting toward the south and west and away from the industrial Midwest and northeast.
With reapportionment settled, the far more politically divisive process of redistricting is set to begin. In Texas, both major parties were bracing for a showdown over the state's new residents, beginning a fight that is sure to spark court action. But with Republican supermajorities in the Legislature, the temptation to run the table will be strong.
Rep. Pete Gallego, D-Alpine, said if the federal courts don't intervene to compel fairness, Republicans will likely produce a map that gives their party the advantage in three or perhaps even all four of the new seats.
"It is very easy to overreach when you're holding the map and have the pen in your hand," he said.
Despite the party's recent gains in the November legislative elections, Republicans won't have unchecked authority to draw the state's congressional map to benefit themselves.
Civil rights laws require that the interests of minority voters be protected as district boundaries are redrawn, and Texas is one of the states whose redistricting plans require "pre-clearance" by federal authorities under the Voting Rights Act.
Democrats are also counting on an assist from the Obama administration, which could have a significant voice in the pre-clearance process. It is the first time since the Voting Rights Act passed that the Justice Department will be in Democratic hands during the redistricting process.
Hispanic growth doesn't automatically translate into Democratic growth, though. Two heavily Hispanic congressional seats in South Texas flipped to Republicans this year. There also are several new Latino GOP members about to be sworn into legislative seats.
South Texas Rep. Aaron Pena, who recently left the Democrat Party and became a Republican, said Texas Latinos are more conservative than their counterparts in western states such as California and Nevada.
Pena, who sits on the House Redistricting Committee, said his "educated guess" was that Republicans would get three of the four seats.
"The Hispanic community is increasingly up for grabs," Pena said. "It's truly a swing population."
Texas already had the largest Republican delegation in Congress, holding 20 of the state's 32 seats. In the 2010 elections, the party picked up another three seats, two of them in heavily Latino districts in South Texas. With all the new growth, Texas will now have 36 seats and 38 presidential electoral votes.

description.hltext_display: Collecte des déchets : attention, tout va changer !
description.content:
A partir du 3 janvier, les tournées de ramassage des poubelles vont être largement modifiées et rationalisées. Grâce à la mécanisation.
Les camions robotisés sont à l'essai sur Parthenay depuis quelques mois et avec des résultats probants, ce qui a conduit la collectivité à généraliser ce système. - (Photo archives NR)
Confié ces trois dernières années à la société Brangeon (49), le marché de la collecte des déchets sur la communauté de communes de Parthenay s'achève le 31 décembre prochain. La collectivité s'est donc penchée il y a trois mois sur le renouvellement de ce marché qui reste un enjeu financier majeur pour la collectivité (voir plus bas).
Harmoniser les secteurs de collecte
« Ce marché a été de nouveau confié à la société Brangeon, car c'est elle qui a répondu le mieux à nos exigences, explique Jacques Dieumegard, vice-président communautaire en charge du dossier. Cette société a en effet proposé de généraliser la collecte robotisée à quasiment tout notre secteur. Ce système a été mis à l'essai ces dernières semaines sur quelques tournées. Cette expérimentation s'est avérée positive, poursuit l'élu, car cela permet de maintenir les coûts, mais aussi la qualité du service et sa rapidité. Cela permet aussi d'employer moins de personnel qui effectuait certaines tâches très pénibles. Ces personnes, d'ailleurs, ne sont pas licenciées, mais redéployées vers d'autres tâches au sein de la société ».
Ces camions robotisés vont donc dès 2011 se généraliser, ce qui va également induire une profonde modification du système de la collecte. Première modification d'importance : la collecte des poubelles jaunes (tous les 15 jours) ne s'effectuera plus le même jour que celles des ordures ménagères, mais la veille, ou le lendemain. De même, les collectes vont être réorganisées géographiquement. « Jusqu'alors, certains secteurs étaient desservis par plusieurs tournées, comme par exemple la rue du Sépulcre où la collecte s'effectuait sur trois jours différents selon que l'on habitait en haut ou en bas, constate David Tessier, directeur des services techniques communautaires. Grâce à ce nouveau système, on va pouvoir harmoniser les secteurs géographiques, qui seront désormais au nombre de 9, et qui auront chacun leur propre calendrier de collecte ».
Des calendriers qui seront déposés dans les jours à venir dans toutes les boîtes à lettres, et qui sont bien sûr à conserver bien précieusement. En cas de perte, voire d'oubli, on peut toujours en demander au service situé rue Béranger. Un document qui fera référence car, si une chose ne change pas, c'est qu'il faudra toujours bien prendre soin de sortir les poubelles la veille au soir du passage des camions.

description.hltext_display: Economía crecerá 2.6% en el 2010
description.content:
La economía de Guatemala crecerá 2.6 por ciento en el 2010, según la evaluación de la política monetaria, cambiaria y crediticia, que conoció la Junta Monetaria (JM).
Según el informe, al cual tuvo acceso Prensa Libre, el aumento de la producción del producto interno bruto (PIB) será mayor al 0.5 por ciento del 2009, pero menor al 4 por ciento del 2008.
“La mayoría de las actividades económicas, con excepción de la explotación de minas y canteras y de la construcción, presentarán tasas de variación positiva durante el 2010, algunas más dinámicas que las del 2009”, señaló el documento.
La actividad de explotación de minas y canteras tendrá en 2010 una caída de 1 por ciento, atribuido por la disminución en la extracción de petróleo y la pérdida de dinamismo en la extracción de minerales metálicos y no metálicos.
El documento detalló que en el caso de la construcción, esta actividad tendrá un caída de 11.2 por ciento, mayor a la de 10.9 por ciento registrada en 2009.
“Hay una menor edificación de obras no residenciales, la cual continúa deprimida y que se refleja en la disminución de licencias de metros cuadrados autorizados por las municipalidades”, agregó.
Otras actividades
En el caso de la agricultura, el sector tendrá un crecimiento de 1.1 por ciento en 2010, atribuido por las pérdidas de producción de cultivos de café y banano, ocasionadas por la erupción del Volcán de Pacaya y la tormenta tropical Ágatha, así como el exceso de lluvias de este año.
La actividad de industria manufacturera cerrará el 2010 con un crecimiento de 2.4 por ciento, debido a una mayor demanda de producción de textiles y prendas de vestir; alimentos y bebidas, y otros productos.
Mientras que el comercio reportará un crecimiento de 3.7 por ciento, transporte, almacenamiento y comunicaciones crecerá 4.2 por ciento; intermediación financiera, 2.6%; suministro de electricidad, 0.5%; servicios privados, 3.8%; alquiler de vivienda, 2.7%; y administración pública y defensa, 7%.

description.hltext_display: Caos en puentes, 4 hrs. para cruzar
description.content:
Cientos de juarenses saturaron ayer los puentes internacionales provocando caos vehicular, Tardaban hasta cuatro horas para internarse al vecino pais. Foto: El Mexicano
A pie y en auto.
Angélica Bustamante / El Mexicano
Ciudad Juárez, Chihuahua.-Son largas e interminables, las filas peatonales, para cruzar a El Paso Texas, en el puente internacional Paso del Norte - Santa Fe, las personas llegaban hasta las vías del tren, de la avenida Ferrocarril.
A todos los que estaban parados en esas filas, no les importaba nada, ni el tiempo, ni el cansancio, ni todos los inconvenientes que se les pudieran presentar.
La gente sabía que son de tres y media a cuatro horas para cruzar, a pesar de eso, lo prefieren para comprar, que hacerlo en esta ciudad.
Por los descuentos, ¡lo que sea!... las cosas bonitas que se compran a bajos precios, vale la pena hacer largas filas.
Lo anterior, fue el comentario de varios de los que estaban en las filas largas y en esta temporada sobre todo, van por los juguetes para los niños.
Las familias enteras haciendo las filas, esposos con ellas, para que al regreso ayudar a cagar.
Cabe destacar que también largas filas se hicieron para abordar el camión que cruza a El Paso, Texas, "El Transborder", que a pesar de cobrar 2 dólares el viaje, tuvo una gran demanda y largas filas de personas para abordarlo.
La unidad pasa cada hora, es su tiempo de movilidad hacia la ciudad de Estados Unidos, vecina de Ciudad Juárez, por lo que más largas todavía, se hicieron las filas para pasar.
Por el camión y la fila del puente, la avenida Juárez, a la altura de la Herrera Jordán, estaba repleta de tanta gente, que no se mira en forma cotidiana.
Todas sus paradas estaban llenas, desde la primera, que se ubica en la plaza Misión de Guadalupe, hasta las que se encuentran en lo que es la entrada del puente internacional Paso del Norte - Santa Fe, o conocido en esta ciudad, como el puente internacional de la zona centro, de la avenida Juárez.

description.hltext_display: New Year’s Eve at home -- does it get any better?
description.content:
There was a time when New Year’s Eve for me was a night out.
It wasn’t so much a party that I was looking forward to as it was an obligation because … who spends New Year’s Eve at home?
People usually ask themselves this question before New Year’s Eve. You should ask it New Year’s Day.
I spent one memorable New Year’s Day pondering this question during a silent car ride home with a bunch of people who all had the taste of last night’s cigars and cocktails still fresh in their mouths. What makes for a so-called fun way to close out the previous year often makes for a lousy way to start the new one. And at a time when new starts and setting the tone for change is so much on our minds, why make the first day of the new year one to forget?
For the last several years, I have happily spent New Year’s Eve at home and embarked on traditions that champagne toasts, ball-drops and revelry can’t touch.
New Year’s Eve is the final leg of the holiday trifecta. By the time I get past Thanksgiving and Christmas, I’m fairly well worn out when it comes to celebrations. Both are fun in their own way, but there is a certain amount of work and stress associated with them. Both require a lot of wrangling of families. Thanksgiving, for me, is either a travel day or a day to recover from who knows how many trips to the grocery store.
Christmas Day is laden with its own traditions and the fatigue of shopping is still weighing on me. I’m mentally, if not physically, battered and bruised by crowded parking lots, crowds and smashing my hurried schedule into the schedule of masses surrounding me in checkout lines and restaurants.
But New Year’s Eve marks the beginning of 36 hours of obligation-free living. There is no family involved. There is no grand meal to prepare for. There are no presents to wrap or open. There are no crowds, parking lots or lines. There is simply a pair of sweats, a remote control and free will.
New Year’s Eve is usually the first chance I will have had to relax in more than a month. In other words, that movie I wanted for Christmas gets its inaugural run through the DVD player (or BluRay player if I’ve played my cards right this year). The book I bought with my gift card gets its first good look. Other gifts finally find their way out of their boxes.
Staying up until midnight, by the way, is for the birds. Why bother? The late nights spent shopping, decorating, wrapping and cooking have let me see the clock strike midnight far too often the previous five weeks. By Dec. 31, there is nothing sexier in this world than a trip to bed around 10 p.m.
And the next day, there is no headache, no wondering how much money was spent and no drama. It’s just another day to continue the holiday healing that I started the night before.
No matter what else 2011 bring my way, I can tell you without hesitation that I’m eagerly awaiting the first day of it.

description.hltext_display: 杨淑君被禁赛三个月 教练禁赛20月无缘伦敦奥运会
description.content:
杨淑君被取消资格后倒在刘聪达怀里痛哭。
世界跆拳道联合会对中华台北跆拳道选手杨淑君亚运会违规事件作出判罚，杨淑君被禁赛三个月，她的教练刘聪达则被禁赛20个月，中华台北跆拳道协会被罚款5万美元。》》》杨淑君电子护具违规 被取消资格泪洒当场
据此间媒体21日报道，世界跆拳道联合会当日致信中华台北跆协，宣布了以上裁决结果。处罚原因一是杨淑君在广州亚运会上使用违规器材，二是选手和教练霸占场地。 这一结果并不影响杨淑君出战伦敦奥运会，但其教练刘聪达基本无缘伦敦。据悉，中华台北跆协将提出上诉。
在11月17日的广州亚运会跆拳道比赛中，杨淑君在对阵越南选手时被发现使用了违规的电子脚套，从而被竞赛监督委员会取消比赛资格。竞赛监督委员会同时认定，杨淑君与教练不服决定，在赛场滞留，影响了比赛的进程。
现年25岁的杨淑君曾在多哈亚运会决赛中不敌中国选手吴静钰获得亚军，北京奥运会四分之一决赛再次不敌吴静钰，最终获得并列第五名。
相关链接： 曝杨淑君师徒恋 教练原计划夺金牌后当场求婚 国台办回应杨淑君事件 表示亚跆联大陆官员已尽力 体坛范特西篮球经理游戏 迎圣诞系列活动给力上线

description.hltext_display: Un nouveau plan en 2011 pour la petite enfance
description.content:
Dans le cadre d'une analyse des besoins sociaux sur la ville, une étude sur l'offre des services '' petite enfance '' est lancée.
La ville va offrir une nouvelle structure d'accueil collectif pour les tout-petits à la rentrée 2011. - (Archives NR)
L'année 2011 sera-t-elle celle de la jeunesse ? Une certitude, la petite enfance sera largement au coeur de la politique municipale. La ville compte actuellement six structures d'accueil et propose aux familles jocondiennes tous les modes d'accueil institutionnels : une maison de la petite enfance, une crèche familiale, deux mini-crèches (Delorme et centre), deux haltes-garderies (centre et Vallée-Violette). S'ajoute un réseau de professionnels (une psychologue, trois puéricultrices, huit éducatrices de jeunes enfants, une animatrice territoriale, dix auxiliaires de puériculture, sept agents de service, trente-neuf assistantes maternelles, une vingtaine d'animateurs vacataires, etc). Le service « petite enfance » comprend aussi le relais d'assistantes maternelles, lieu ressource pour parents et assistantes maternelles indépendantes.
Adjointe chargée à l'enfance, Marie-Dominique Boisseau annonce plusieurs réflexions et réalisations pour l'an prochain. « La demande s'oriente plus facilement vers l'accueil collectif. Nous allons offrir à la rentrée 2011 de nouveaux locaux dans les anciens locaux de l'école maternelle Blotterie... ». Les travaux viennent d'ailleurs de démarrer.
Le centre de La Borde pour les 4-5 ans
Outre la conception d'un projet multi-accueil sur l'école Blotterie, d'autres actions s'imposent au comité de pilotage : la modification de certains horaires de structures, une offre plus importante de places en accueil collectif, l'accompagnement des familles en recherche d'assistante maternelle.
Marie-Dominique Boisseau précise que les 3-4 ans seront accueillis à la Vallée-Violette (accueil de loisirs). Les « 5 ans » seront orientés au centre de La Borde une fois que les travaux de rénovation seront achevés.
Le plan « petite enfance » est en marche.

description.hltext_display: Rivera impugna la rebeldía en su contra
description.content:
La costarricense Guiselle Rivera, ex fiscal de la Cicig, impugnó la rebeldía que le dictó el Juzgado Segundo de Instancia Penal.
Anterior Siguiente
Fernando Linares, abogado de Rivera, informó que la impugnación se debe a que la ex fiscal de la Comisión Internacional contra la Impunidad en Guatemala (Cicig) busca esclarecer su situación legal.
“Lo que se pretende al declarar su rebeldía es colocar una mordaza y no venga al país para que declare lo que sabe en los casos que llevó a cabo”, expuso Linares.
El Ministerio Público pidió la rebeldía, ya que Rivera afirmó en algunos medios de comunicación que no viajaría a Guatemala. A la profesional se le señala de patrocinio infiel, doble representación y encubrimiento propio.

description.hltext_display: Options abound on New Year’s Eve
description.content:
Options for New Year’s Eve celebrations vary widely: a festive dinner at your favorite restaurant, a special theater performance, a community party, a concert or band show with or without dancing. We include a sampler here, including a couple thoughts for the short set.
Fireworks
You can look down the Front Range and see them on Pike’s Peak, or you can hop the Light Rail to 16th and California and enjoy an immersion experience.
The Downtown Denver Partnership fills the skies above the 16th Street Mall with a great fireworks display, launched simultaneously from several building tops at 9 p.m. and again at midnight. The two shows are identical and can be viewed all along the mall. If you have a goofy hat, this is a place where it won’t be alone. Food and drink spots are crowded and a general good mood permeates the crowd. (It’s a good plan to establish a meeting place if your group gets separated).
Lannie’s Clocktower Cabaret, on the Mall at Arapahoe Street, offers entertainment by vocalist Lannie Garrett and her Big Band— with time out to watch the fireworks. Tickets: $125. See www.lannies,com or call 303-293-0075.
Fundraiser
Greet the New Year in Castle Rock at Douglas County Fairgrounds’ Kirks Hall: A celebration to raise money for two charities, Project Sanctuary and Reeces Roundup.
Dancing at 9 p.m.
Champagne toast at 12 a.m.
Tickets are normally $40 single/$75 couple (limited time discount). Tickets can be purchased at Automaster, 3160 No. Industrial Way, Castle Rock or call 303-660-6150.
Ticket price includes:
Dinner buffet put on by Sweet Lorraine’s Catering includes roast beef and pork loin.
Noise makers
Champagne toast at midnight
Coffee and dessert bar
Live entertainment and dancing
Cash bar available.
Proceeds from ticket sales and bar will go to the charities. Those who would like to purchase a ticket but can’t attend the event can donate tickets to a military couple who might not otherwise be able to afford to attend.
Theater programs
The 17th Avenue Allstars will perform two shows, 6:30 p.m. and 9:30 p.m. at Town Hall Arts Center, 2450 W. Main St., Downtown Littleton. The a capella quintet will sing favorites from five decades. Included: Baritone Barry Brown, Tenor Tim Rosendo, Bass Norm Silver, Vocal Percussionist Richard Steighner, Tenor Bob Shammas. Tickets: all reserved seats $25. (A champagne toast is included in the 9:30 ticket). 303-794-2787 ext. 5, www.townhallartscenter.com.
Captain Quirk and Friends perform “Tommy,” the Who’s Pete Townshend work that coined the words “Rock Opera” at 8 p.m. at Miner’s Alley Playhouse, 13th and Washington, Golden. Award-winning music director Donna Debreceni performs on keyboards, with a band including Rick Thompson, bass; Mitch Jervis, guitar and Larry Ziehl, drums. They accompany vocalists Traci Kern and Daniel Langhoff in the tale about a deaf, dumb and blind boy who becomes leader of a messianic movement. Ticket: $40 per person, $70 Couple, 21 and over only. Includes one complimentary cocktail, hors d’oeuvres at intermission, dancing and party 10 to midnight after the show, complimentary champagne at midnight. (Cash bar). In cooperation with Table Mountain Inn across the street, two packages are offered: $199 per couple includes ticket, room, breakfast; $299 includes ticket, dinner, room, breakfast. 303-935-3044, www.minersalley.com.
“A Very Dark Holiday Playwright Festivus” offers six holiday-themed one acts written by Colorado playwrights, each with a local director, including a show at 7:30 p.m. Dec. 31 at Vintage Theatre, 2119 E. 17th Ave., Denver. Included: “Silent Night” by Jeffery Neuman; “’Tis the Season” by Linda Berry; “Intimate Information” by Frank A. Oteri; “Ringing It In” by Laura Coe; “Bored to Death” by Mark Sbani; “Family Business” by Kurt Brighton. Tickets: $15, 303-839-1361, vintagetheatre.com.
”I’ll Be Home for Christmas ...a USO Show” plays through Dec. 31 at Heritage Square Music Hall, 18301 W. Colfax Ave. Golden. Heritage Square Music Hall offers eight hours of food, laughs, wonderful desserts, dancing and bottomless champagne at midnight, with keepsake glasses. Tickets: Buffet dinner, show and more, $100; show only, $70. 303-279-7800.
Comedy Works Landmark DTC and Larimer Square offer early all-ages shows and later ones for grownups, with Brad Upton in the south venue and Ralph Harris downtown. For details: 303-595-3637, www.comedyworks.com.
Music
(Check with your favorite local spots.) Three options:
“Night in Vienna” a tradition with the Colorado Symphony Orchestra, offers polkas, waltzes and marches beginning at 6:30 p.m. at Boettcher Concert Hall, Denver Performing Arts Complex. Afterwards, stroll down to the 16th Street Mall to enjoy the 9 p.m. fireworks. Tickets: $37 to $90. www.coloradosymphony.org or 303-623-7876.
Denver Favorite Hazel Miller and her band will perform at 9 p.m. at the Sherman Street Event Center, 1770 Sherman St., Denver. A dessert bar and champagne at midnight included in the ticket price of $55 per person, $100 Couple — 21 and over only. Visit shermansteventcenter.com, 303-778-0916, TicketsWest at King Soopers. A portion of the proceeds benefits KUVO Jazz radio.
Award-winning bluesman Otis Taylor and his band will play at Dazzle Jazz Lounge, 930 Lincoln St., Denver. A 6:30 pre-gala includes show and dinner. $25 pre-pay, $50 total. The 8:30 gala has Taylor in the showroom and Supercollider in the Dizzy Lounge. $30 pre-pay, $70 total (favors, champagne at midnight). Ticket holders can go back and forth between dance floors. Reservations, 303-839-5100, info@dazzlejazz.com.
For the kids
Noon Year’s Eve, 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. at the Children’s Museum offers five ball drops a’la Times Square, countdowns, massive sheets of bubble wrap that sound like fireworks when one jumps on them, art activities, performances, cookies. Stories by Lars the Polar Bear. Admission: $6, 1 and under; $8, 2 to 59; $6 seniors. www.cmdenver.org, 303-433-7444. Bright lights, magical surroundings. All require admission.
Zoo Year’s Eve starts at 5 p.m. at the Denver Zoo, with an early countdown at 9 p.m. Zoo lights, activities, entertainment.
Hudson Holidays is open 5 to 9 p.m., 6115 S. Santa Fe Drive, Littleton.
Blossoms of Light at both Chatfield And York Street Denver Botanic Gardens.

description.hltext_display: Apology coming from Australian govt in Haneef case, says lawyer
description.content:
PTI Rod Hodgson, lawyer of Mohammed Haneef (in picture) today said that the Australian government had agreed to issue a public apology reaffirming the doctor’s innocence, a report in the ABC said. File photo
Related
NEWS
TOPICS
World Australia
crime, law and justice international law
The Australian government is expected to issue a public apology for the wrongful detention of Mohammad Haneef, the lawyer for the Indian doctor said today, a day after winning a settlement over his compensation claim.
Dr. Haneef, who was detained after being wrongly accused of having links to the failed Glasglow bombing attempt in 2007, on Tuesday struck a deal with the government for receiving ‘substantial’ compensation over the bungled case after two days of negotiation.
His lawyer Rod Hodgson today said that the Australian government had also agreed to issue a public apology reaffirming the doctor’s innocence, a report in the ABC said.
“I’m not sure precisely when it’s going to be publicised but you can expect that there will be a public apology to Haneef reaffirming his innocence,” he said.
“The Commonwealth has recognised that through this process and that’s an absolutely tremendous outcome for Haneef to have,” he said.
He said the financial settlement was “substantial” and Dr. Haneef was “delighted” with the deal.
In return, Dr. Haneef has dropped a civil claim against the government and defamation action against the former immigration minister Kevin Andrews, who had revoked the doctor’s visa after he got bail.
“The resolution of this matter will lead to the cessation of all legal proceedings against the Commonwealth and Andrews,” he said.
The amount of the financial compensation agreed upon has been kept under wraps, and the government said the terms of the settlement could not be revealed because of a confidentiality agreement.
According to lawyer Peter Russo, who has been representing Dr. Haneef since he was held in detention, his client’s reputation was not tarnished forever.
“I would hope not. I would hope that the average Australian would see that he was an innocent man and allow him to get on with his life now,” he said.
He said Dr. Haneef was a quiet man who has handled the episode and its aftermath with courage.
“His demeanor really has not changed throughout his ordeal,” Mr. Russo said.
“In my view, I think he handled it with a great deal of courage and it’s a credit to himself that he handled it the way he did,” he said.
The former immigration minister Andrews, however, is still unmoved.
He said the claim for defamation against him was always “adventurous” and he has made no apology and paid no compensation to Dr. Haneef.
“I have been advised that Haneef has withdrawn his action for defamation against me,” Mr. Andrews said in a statement.
“I have made no apology. Nor has any compensation been paid in relation to the defamation action. In other words, the claim against me was not pursued and has been withdrawn,” he said.
Mr. Andrews said based on the legal advice he received, he was always confident that the claim for defamation was “adventurous” and would not have succeeded.
The Greens said they are not convinced the Federal Government has put enough safeguards in place to prevent a repeat of the Haneef affair.
But Attorney—General Robert McClelland insisted the government has put extra safeguards in national security legislation to avoid a similar situation occurring again.
Greens Senator Sarah Hanson—Young said she does not believe there are sufficient checks in place.
“There were commitments to review various parts of the anti—terror legislation and the limits on being held without charge,” she said.
“My understanding is that we haven’t seen a resolution yet to the review of those anti—terror legislation laws. So until we do, I’m not sure it’s fixed,” she said.
Dr. Haneef is a cousin of Sabeel Ahmed —— the main accused in the failed attack on the Glasgow International Airport in the UK in 2007.
He was taken into custody and charged with recklessly giving support to a terrorist organisation when his mobile phone SIM card, which he had left with his cousin before coming to Australia from the UK, was linked to the attack.
His detention was the longest without charge in recent Australian history, and his case caused a lot of outrage in India as well as in Australia.
Keywords: Australian laws, Mohammad Haneef, terror suspect

[이데일리 함정선 기자] 방송통신위원회가 이르면 내년 3월 인터넷에서 삭제될 수 있는 `명백한 허위`와 `유언비어`의 기준을 정한다.
방통위는 22일 이르면 내년 3월 긴장상황 때 포털업체가 자율적으로 명백한 허위사실이나 유언비어 등을 삭제하는 데 활용할 수 있는 가이드라인을 만들 것이라고 밝혔다. 또한 긴장상황에 대한 기준 역시 마련될 전망이다.
방통위는 이날 최근 연평도 포격 사건과 관련, 정부가 인터넷 글을 무단으로 삭제하는 방안을 추진하고 있다는 보도에 대해 해명하며 이같이 밝혔다.
인터넷 글이 명백한 허위사실이나 유언비어일 때 포털이 자율적으로 삭제하는 방침은 고수하되, 이때 활용할 가이드라인을 만든다는 것이다.
엄열 네트워크정책국 네트워크윤리팀장은 "내년 상반기 내로 가이드라인을 만들 것"이라며 "해외 소셜네트워크사업자(SNS)들에 대해서는 망법을 적용하는 등 방안을 마련할 것"이라고 말했다.
＜ⓒ종합 경제정보 미디어 이데일리 - 무단전재&재배포 금지＞
